mdRecord.dcterms:title: Documents relating to land dispute between Posey and West
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Includes the following: 1) Report of John West Junr, and Philip Alexander on a tract of land disputed between Capt. John Posey and West -- Date on original catalog card appears [1769] [July 10]. | Docketed on back "West v Posey Plat & Report", in George Washington's hand, laminated, watermark (crown over heraldic device & motto, & crown over GR), oversize document. | [This was part of the original grant to Spencer which George Washington purchased from Captain Posey to help cancel that gentleman's debt to him and others]. The plat showing survey lines is attached to the report. A cover is attached, docketed "Papers Relating To Mount Vernon Trace of Land."; 2) Plat of land, 1925 acres, part of Mount Vernon tract -- Docketed on reverse in George Washington's hand, "Papers relating to Mount Vernon Tract of Land," oversize document, laminated, watermark (heraldic emblem and motto "Honi soit que mal y pense"). Date on original catalog card appears [1769] [July 10]. [Found with papers rel
